channel.title: [Tutorial] Indepth Inheritance explaination
channel.description:
[b]Purpose:[/b] To teach you inheritance. And how to use it between classes.
[u]Definitions[/u]
[b]Modifier[/b] - [i]Putting modifiers before methods and classes (like static) changes their return type, what they can be accessed by, ect.[/i] [b]Class[/b] - [i]A java file. Which we can run and use values from.[/i] [b]Field[/b] - [i]A value that can vary and be changed.[/i] [b]Method[/b] - [i]Methods do actions rather than have their value changed in certain instances like variables.[/i]
[u]Explaination of Inheritance[/u]
Inheritance allows us to use values from a different class without making the variable or method static and using the ClassName.method to use them. we simply use the extends modifier. As soon as we inherit values from a class it becomes the superclass of the class that has inherited those variables and methods from the class. That class may not be able to acces all the variables and methods if they have certain modifiers, like 'private'.
Modifier Acces Table: [IMG]http://i160.photobucket.com/albums/t167/nirvanasmarijuana/AccessTable.jpg[/img]
If they can be accessed you can use them as if they were in the same class. Heres an example of a class with the extends Modifier: [code]public class NirvanasClass extends Music {[/code]
That be able to access any method or varible within that class except for variables or methods with no modifier or the private modifier.
If I had a private method within music the subclass will not be able to access it. For Example:
[code]private string[] songs {"Lithium", "Breed", "Polly", "Drain You", "In Bloom", "Stay Away", "On a Plain"};[/code]
It you tried to use that field in NirvanasClass you'd get compiling errors.
[u]Summary[/u] So basicly inheritance means you can use variables and methods in another class as if they were in the actual class. So you wouldnt need to use the ClassName.varName of using them in different classes.

item.title: [Tutorial] Indepth Inheritance explaination
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

The general rule for writing a tutorial is knowing remotely what you’re talking about.[quote="† Nirvana †, post:1, topic:133123"]private string[] songs {"Lithium", "Breed", "Polly", "Drain You", "In Bloom", "Stay Away", "On a Plain"};

It you tried to use that method in NirvanasClass you’d get compiling errors.[/quote]That’s not a method. It’s a field.[quote="† Nirvana †, post:1, topic:133123"]Class - A java file. Which we can run and use values from.
Variable - A value that can vary and be changed.
Method - Methods do actions rather than have their value changed in certain instances like variables.[/quote]What the hell is this variable shit? Variables only occur in Java in methods as local variables. You’re talking about fields.

Most things still unsaid since I don’t want moderated, this sucks in too many senses of the word.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Indepth Inheritance explaination
item.dc:creator: @_Nirvana † Nirvana †
item.description:
@_Nirvana wrote:

Purpose: To teach you inheritance. And how to use it between classes.

Definitions

Modifier - Putting modifiers before methods and classes (like static) changes their return type, what they can be accessed by, ect.
Class - A java file. Which we can run and use values from.
Field - A value that can vary and be changed.
Method - Methods do actions rather than have their value changed in certain instances like variables.

Explaination of Inheritance

Inheritance allows us to use values from a different class without making the variable or method static and using the ClassName.method to use them. we simply use the extends modifier. As soon as we inherit values from a class it becomes the superclass of the class that has inherited those variables and methods from the class. That class may not be able to acces all the variables and methods if they have certain modifiers, like ‘private’.

Modifier Acces Table:

If they can be accessed you can use them as if they were in the same class. Heres an example of a class with the extends Modifier:

public class NirvanasClass extends Music {

That be able to access any method or varible within that class except for variables or methods with no modifier or the private modifier.

If I had a private method within music the subclass will not be able to access it. For Example:

private string[] songs {"Lithium", "Breed", "Polly", "Drain You", "In Bloom", "Stay Away", "On a Plain"};

It you tried to use that field in NirvanasClass you’d get compiling errors.

Summary
So basicly inheritance means you can use variables and methods in another class as if they were in the actual class. So you wouldnt need to use the ClassName.varName of using them in different classes.

Read full topic
